section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 20. Chapter 20: External Causes of Morbidity > i. Sequelae (Late Effects) of External Cause Guidelines > 1) Sequelae external cause codes

content.full_text: Sequela are reported using the external cause code with the 7th character 'S' for sequela. These codes should be used with any report of a late effect or sequela resulting from a previous injury. (Evidence: pg no: 91, L30-L31)
content.summary: Specific instructions for using sequela external cause codes with 7th character 'S' (Evidence: pg no: 91, L30-L31)
key_concepts: 7th character 'S' indicates sequela (Evidence: pg no: 91, L30)
Used for any late effect or sequela (Evidence: pg no: 91, L31)
Must relate to previous injury (Evidence: pg no: 91, L31)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Use 7th character 'S' for sequela in external cause codes (Evidence: pg no: 91, L30)
detailed_rules.explanation: The 7th character 'S' specifically designates that the external cause code is being used to indicate a sequela or late effect (Evidence: pg no: 91, L30)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify condition as sequela of previous injury
Step 2: Select appropriate external cause code
Step 3: Apply 7th character 'S' to indicate sequela

code_patterns.description: Standard pattern for sequela external cause coding (Evidence: pg no: 91, L30)
code_patterns.explanation: Indicates this external cause is for a sequela

best_practices: Always use 7th character 'S' for sequela external cause codes (Evidence: pg no: 91, L30)
tips: Apply to any report of late effect or sequela (Evidence: pg no: 91, L31)
